intro: Didissandra lutea, commonly known as the golden sandstone plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a shallow root system that allows it to thrive in rocky soils. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
